title: Case Study: Progressive Distal Muscle Weakness in a Young Adult with Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease
clinical_history: Michael S., a 24-year-old male graduate student, reports a five-year history of progressive difficulty with walking and frequent tripping. He describes having had unusually high arches since adolescence and recently has noticed increasing weakness in his lower legs and hands. Over the past year, he has experienced difficulty rising onto his toes, frequent ankle sprains, and muscle cramps during moderate activity. His mother was diagnosed with a similar condition in her 40s. On examination, Michael displays bilateral foot drop, visible muscle atrophy in the anterior lower legs and hand intrinsics, and diminished deep tendon reflexes in the lower limbs. He experiences fatigue and mild, intermittent neuropathic pain in his feet after prolonged standing.

nprs.affected_area: bilateral distal lower leg muscles (anterior tibialis, peronei)

aggrevating_factors: Prolonged walking or standing (>30 minutes), walking on uneven ground, cold temperatures, and moderate-intensity exercise.
picture: Image suggestion: Marked wasting of anterior tibialis with bilateral pes cavus deformity and clawing of toes.
easing_factors: Rest, wearing ankle-foot orthoses (AFOs), and gentle stretching. Uses warm packs for comfort.
past_history: No history of major trauma; childhood milestones were within normal limits but recalls being the slowest runner in school. Family history notable for motherâ€™s similar neurological symptoms.
medical_history: Generally healthy; history of resolved mild asthma in childhood.
medications: Occasional ibuprofen for muscle discomfort; no regular medication.
personal_history: Lives with a partner, supportive home environment. Ambitious student experiencing anxiety regarding future employment due to increasing physical limitations. Enjoys reading and computer gaming.
imaging: Nerve conduction studies show reduced conduction velocities consistent with a demyelinating neuropathy. No advanced imaging performed to date.
